The Secret of
AMERICAN
Surveys continue to spotlight the fact that a great
many American citizens, young and old, do not
understand what makes the American system so
productive. Utilizing the flannelboard and other
visual aids. Dr. Ganus in this film discusses the five
major factors in our incomparable production
mechanism: (1) Freedom to Work; (2) Freedom
to Dream; (3) Freedom to Compete; (4) Freedom
to Advance; (5) Freedom to Invest. The great
tool story is told — America’s $ 10,000-plus invest¬
ment in each industrial job and what this means to
the employee and the consuming public, in wages
and better products. With Disney-like cartooning
a comparison is drawn between the worker in China
and the worker in America to dramatize the value
of high tool investment.
Above: Dr. Ganus, with the aid of the class, builds the five free¬
doms vital to America’s great productivity. Right (above): progress
in automobile production advanced with enormous investments in
machine tools; the productivity of the coolie, with a 10-cent tool
is compared with America's railroad carrier.
